intro: Psychotria hirtella, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it its common name. It produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Psychotria hirtella is often found in secondary forests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
